results.title: I am a litter basket
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Stewart McAllister, Edgar H. Anstey and James Ritchie
results.brief_description: A jocular contribution to Britain’s anti-litter campaign. It is directed at those who throw their litter everywhere but into the waiting waste-paper baskets.

results.title: I am a guitar
results.brief_description: Shows how Ignacio Fleta and his sons lovingly shape and sand classical guitar frames, apply the inlaid rosette that is their trademark and polish the well-seasoned Cuban cedar, etc that constitutes the kind of instrument Andres Segovia or John Williams would wait a decade to play. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: I am a dancer
results.creator_credit: Demetrion Productions, Office de Radiodiffusion Television Francais, Evdoros Demetriou and Pierre Jourdan
results.brief_description: Rudolf Nureyev is considered one of the world’s greatest dancers and this documentary provides an insight to the man, his work and his passion for the art of ballet. Includes segments from four ballets with partners Margot Fonteyn (Marguerite and Armand), Carla Fracci, (La Sylphide), Lynn Seymour (The Sleeping beauty), and Deanne Bergsma (Field figures). A French/British co-production with narration by Bryan Forbes.

results.title: I am a country
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films, ONF | NFB and Herb Taylor
results.brief_description: Provides a showcase for products manufactured in Canada, including heavy duty machinery for Canadian conditions, aircraft designed for special duties, women’s fashions and other items, all bearing the “Made In Canada” label.

results.title: I am
results.creator_credit: Wombat Productions, Inc. and Gene Feldman
results.brief_description: Deals with the quest of a boy, entering adolescence, to discover who he is, what makes a person important, and how one gets to be somebody. Emphasises the importance of introspection, fantasy, and attempts at forming meaningful relationships in the development of the individual identity.

results.title: I accuse = J'accuse
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of the most important anti-war films ever made, Abel Gance’s 1939 film is a remake of his original 1919 silent film. With the prospect of World War 2 imminent, gabel reconstructed his original to challenge the world. Jean Diaz is a research scientist who dedicates his life to ending war. When he discovers that his work is being exploited by the military, he summons up the ghosts of the war dead to make the world come to its senses.

results.title: I've heard the mermaids singing
results.creator_credit: VOS Productions, Patricia Rozema and Alexandra Raffe
results.brief_description: This multi award-winning debut film by Canadian director Patricia Rozema (When night is falling, 1995) is delightful in its quirkiness, touching humour and cinematic aesthetics. Polly (Sheila McCarthy) is endearing as the single 31 year-old naive, scatty secretary who has problems in keeping a job, and who uses her photography as a way of escaping into a magical dreamworld of fantasy where she can be whoever she wants to be. When Gabrielle (Paule Baillargeon), curator of an art gallery and an aspiring artist, takes Polly on as her permanent part-time assistant, Polly is ecstatic and it is not long before Polly finds herself totally infatuated with the worldly sophisticated and beautiful Gabrielle. But all is not as it seems and the story takes an unexpected twist when Mary (Ann-Marie MacDonald), artist and ex-lover of Gabrielle’s arrives on the scene. Weaving between color and black and white, reality and fantasy, this lyrical film of the abstract world of art and artists is refreshingly original and Sheila McCarthy as Polly is just superb. Cast also includes Richard Monette and John Evans. Written by Patricia Rozema and cinematography by Douglas Koch. (Awards: Cannes; Genie Awards) NB: Inconsistent sound quality.

results.title: I'm talking about my life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Le Videographe, Angelina Luke, Joann Geschiecht and Garry Bietel
results.brief_description: Angelina is married to a violent man with a drinking problem. But her Malaysian culture makes it hard for her to leave but when she does she she succeeds. She then becomes determined to help other women in similar situations.

results.title: I'm still a woman
results.creator_credit: Joyce Mann Productions and Joyce Mann
results.brief_description: Three weeks before her wedding, Mrs Joyce Mann discovered that she had a lump in her breast. After a mastectomy she and her husband found just how few facilities there were for women who were considered mutilated. Before a group of nurses, Mrs Mann explains and demonstrates her experience, and the underwear she has worn and now wears. Another cancer victim shows that now, at times breasts can be reconstructed.
